conclusion: Plan to analyze image and conditions about angles of incidence and total internal reflection.
Image shows a cross-section of an equilateral triangular glass prism with two monochromatic lights, a and b, entering from the air perpendicular to the hypotenuse.
Light a is closer to the base of the prism, light b is closer to the top.
The prism is equilateral, meaning all angles are 60 degrees.
Both lights a and b are incident at the same angle from the glass to the air.
Total internal reflection occurs when the angle of incidence equals the critical angle.
The critical angle depends on the refractive indices of the glass and air.
As the angle of incidence increases, light b will reach the critical angle first.
Light b will undergo total internal reflection before light a.
